page.title: 07Cropwell Bishop Village Hall
page.content: The Memorial Hall has been standing for about 56 years.In 1932 the{Prince {of Wales}visited and opened it.There are lots of things going on in there,these are some of them: Guides,jumble-sales, fetes and galas and lots more things.At the back of the Memorial Hall the grass is quite high.When it was first built the plantation was beautiful.The Guides some-times have barbeques on the playing field by the hall.Many people play on the park at the bottom of the field. At the top of the field there are some {Gypsy caravans.}There used to be a very vicious dog there but it died a few years ago.Some of the kids from the village play foot-ball,cricket,and rounders,on the field as well we all share our fun there."ITS GREAT". {AUTHOR:Joanne Westmoreland.
